intro: Gynochthodes rigida, commonly known as the rigid gynochthodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Gynochthodes rigida is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
